title: What can you learn from ancient poop?

multiple-choice.question: What are the fossilized remains of ancient human feces called?

options.label: A
options.text: Coprolites

options.label: B
options.text: Fossilized waste

options.label: C
options.text: Ancient dung

options.label: D
options.text: Poop fossils

multiple-choice.question: How do archaeologists typically find coprolites?

options.label: A
options.text: By digging up ancient toilets

options.label: B
options.text: By searching for dried-out feces in caves or mummies

options.label: C
options.text: By analyzing ancient sewage systems

options.label: D
options.text: By examining fossilized feces in rock formations

multiple-choice.question: What can be preserved along with ancient feces in coprolites?

options.label: A
options.text: Only the feces itself

options.label: B
options.text: Intestinal parasites like whipworms

options.label: C
options.text: Food particles and other organic matter

options.label: D
options.text: Only minerals and water

multiple-choice.question: What can be learned from the analysis of ancient feces in coprolites?

options.label: A
options.text: Only the age of the feces

options.label: B
options.text: The diet and lifestyle of ancient humans

options.label: C
options.text: The presence of intestinal parasites and diseases

options.label: D
options.text: The color of the feces

multiple-choice.question: What was discovered about the death of Cangrande della Scala through the analysis of his feces?

options.label: A
options.text: That he died of natural causes

options.label: B
options.text: That he was poisoned with a plant

options.label: C
options.text: That he died of a severe bout of vomiting and diarrhea

options.label: D
options.text: That he had a rare disease
